blocks.value: Saint Gonsalo Garcia was born in Bassein, India (near Mumbai) around 1556 to Portuguese parents. He is honored as the first Indian-born saint and a martyr of Japan.

After working as a merchant, Gonsalo felt called to religious life and joined the Franciscan Order. He traveled to Japan as a missionary, where Christianity was beginning to face severe persecution under Toyotomi Hideyoshi.

In 1597, Gonsalo was arrested along with 25 other Christians. They were paraded through towns as a warning, then crucified on a hill in Nagasaki. Gonsalo sang hymns and preached from his cross before being pierced with spears. He was canonized in 1862.
